content: of overcompensating or undercompensating for your gauge is uncommon there is a youtube video for this too when you ve finished your pattern work another complete row in a single color order usually the same as the color order of the selvedge pair work the last pair rather than slipping it if you re working on circular needles slide to the other end if on straights slip all sts to the other needle either way the needle s point should now be sticking out of the wrong edge of the work now slip 1 kwise slip 1 pwise psso slip 1 kwise psso slip 1 pwise psso keep slipping your knits kwise and your purls pwise and whenever you have 2 sts on the needle psso when you reach the end you ll have a single pair 2 sts on your needle break the ends pass both ends through both loops and tighten please do not distribute or modify this pattern without permission support hardworking knitwear designers this pattern © 2006 2016 alasdair post-quinn visit www double-knitting com for more info and patterns weaving in ends 4 double-knitting is hollow feed your ends into the spaces between layers with a tapestry needle being careful to keep the needle inside the work at all times when you feel you ve gone far enough bring the needle and ends out snip them near the base of their exit point then give the fabric a tug and the ends will disappear inside this works especially well on grippy fibers like wool if you like you can bring the ends to the surface then pass them through the same hole in another direction repeat as many times as necessary this will help to securely anchor the ends blocking blocking double-knitting is basically the same as blocking standard knitting with one caveat two layers are more absorbent than one soak and drain as usual and pin out on your blocking board dry overnight i use a fan to speed things up and then this is important turn the piece over and pin out again to make sure that both sides dry com- pletely this pattern requires some heavy blocking the wavy edges should straighten out very well and almost if not completely disappear when dry pattern co 31 ba pairs key 1 work 8 repeats of chart 1 16 row 2 work 2 repeats of chart 2 4 row layer 1 ab pair 3 work chart 3 layer 2 ba pair 4 work 3 repeats of chart 2 6 row 5 work repeats of chart 4 until you don t have enough yarn to finish another layer 1 ba pair repeat count your completed chart 4 repeats work the same number of layer 2 ab pair chart 4 repeats again switching to the second pair of skeins when necessary this is done to make the scarf as long as possible while guaranteeing you linked pair won t run out of yarn 6 work 2 repeats
